main event: Multiple unidentified flying objects were observed in the vicinity of Patrick Air Force Base, Florida, from 8 June 1954 to 18 June 1954.
interesting points: Over two hundred witnesses, including officers, administrative personnel, and technical experts, observed a flashlight-type beam moving in a northerly direction near the coast of Florida. The witnesses were thoroughly trained in missile identification and electronic warfare.
One witness, Capt. Stanton, reported a smaller object accompanying the main object, traveling at a high rate of speed before disappearing from view.

A metallic, disc-shaped object was observed moving at a high rate of speed, climbing and descending rapidly, and remaining visible until dark. It was characterized as much brighter than a flashbulb burst.
Another sighting described a solid, oval-shaped, lighted object several times larger than a visible star, with a rate of speed greater than 3/5.

UFO sightings included objects appearing stationary before accelerating and moving rapidly to a different direction, as well as objects that would appear in the sky, remain stationary for a few seconds, then disappear and reappear in a different location.
sighted object: Multiple unidentified flying objects, including flashlight-type beams, metallic disc-shaped objects, and solid, oval-shaped lighted objects
witnesses: Over two hundred credible witnesses, including officers, administrative personnel, and technical experts
photographs: No, the report does not include photographs
